title: 109_s2086
content: The "IRA Equity Act of 2005" is the short title of the Act. It includes provisions for the computation of limits on IRA and Roth IRA contributions. Certain wage replacement income is treated as compensation for purposes of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This includes applicable wage replacement income received by an individual due to disability. Certain wage replacement income received due to disability is treated as compensation for purposes of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This includes disability income under workmen's compensation acts or regulations prescribed by the Secretary. Excludable amounts for Roth IRAs are determined by taking into account compensation described in section 219(f)(8) without regard to whether it is includible in gross income. The amendments made by this subsection apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2004. A taxpayer may elect to take into account any unused compensation from the 2 taxable years immediately preceding the taxable year for Roth IRA deductions. Unused compensation refers to the individual's gross income for a taxable year minus deductions, nondeductible contributions, and contributions to a Roth IRA for that year. The amendment allows for the inclusion of unused compensation from the individual or their spouse in the two previous taxable years when determining the limitation for contributions to an IRA. The amendment allows for the inclusion of unused compensation from previous taxable years when determining IRA contribution limits. Unused compensation from years before January 1, 2005, can be considered for taxable years starting after December 31, 2004.
